paper: Emergent Bayesian Behaviour and Optimal Cue Combination in LLMs

differences.summary: Composite score/normalization mismatch and misleading Figure 9 plotting
differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines trust in core metric aggregation and visual evidence

evidence.baseline_quote: BayesBench breakdown bars in Figure 9 are approximate ('~') and do not provide exact numeric values
evidence.final_quote: Figure 9 'NRMSE (A)' plots raw NRMSE; 'Total' seems to sum components despite S=(A+E+C)/3

differences.summary: BCS definition vs reported values (non-integer outputs)
differences.why_impacts_score: Creates ambiguity about metric validity and interpretation

evidence.baseline_quote: BCS captures only the sign of prior-weight change and applies a hard threshold s_a=0 when w_prior>0.9
evidence.final_quote: Per-task BCS are non-integers in Table 4 despite integer s_a definition, creating definitional ambiguity

differences.summary: Reproducibility: discard criteria noted without reporting rates
differences.why_impacts_score: Missing discard statistics hinder reproducibility and bias assessment

evidence.baseline_quote: API non-determinism and silent vendor updates are acknowledged but not mitigated via version pinning or multiple runs
evidence.final_quote: Discard criteria described ('ill-formed responses are discarded') but no discard rates reported; threatens reproducibility

differences.summary: Kalman observer notation ambiguity (μ_{t|t} vs μ_{t|t−1})
differences.why_impacts_score: Ambiguity can alter model fits and undermine technical rigor

evidence.baseline_quote: Sequential effects are probed with a Kalman filter, and examples of model fits are shown
evidence.final_quote: Notational ambiguity: unclear whether y_t is generated from μ_{t|t} or μ_{t|t−1} (Section 3.2; Eqs. 3–4)

differences.why_impacts_score: Compromises evidence quality and modality comparisons

evidence.baseline_quote: Some plots conflate or inconsistently label axes/scales, complicating interpretation and comparability
evidence.final_quote: Appendix Figure 16 includes duplicate/missing entries that make modality comparisons hard to interpret

differences.summary: Ambiguity on affine/gain variants across sections
differences.why_impacts_score: Inconsistent model variant descriptions reduce clarity and reproducibility

evidence.baseline_quote: Log-transform and affine variants are included to capture Weber-like scaling and response miscalibration
evidence.final_quote: Section 3.2 suggests affine/gain for 'non-linear models', Appendix A.13.2 restricts affine to Bayesian, creating ambiguity

differences.summary: Lower overall score explicitly tied to core reporting and composite mismatch
differences.why_impacts_score: Adds explicit rationale linking reporting flaws to reduced confidence

evidence.baseline_quote: Overall (10): 7 — ... but metric/reporting inconsistencies and methodological assumptions ... temper technical solidity
evidence.final_quote: Overall (10): 6 — ... several core reporting inconsistencies ... and a composite score/normalization mismatch with Eq. (5) ... temper confidence
